page.title: 07Housing in Five Oak Green
page.content: uring the last 20 years our village buildings and population has changed. Most of the land was farmland,with farm houses,cottages and post war council housing. A new estate off Oak Road, built by Sunley Homes and a Gough Cooper estate, off Sychem Lane,were built about 20 year ago. The value of these houses has risen from 4950 pounds to 38000 pounds upwards. To accommodate the increased population the Victorian school was extended and modernised. A Community Centre was built.There was much argument about the centre.People thought there would be a lot of noise. Now it is fully used for community activities. There are many converted oasts ,they became redundant as farm buildings.
